channel.title: Subpatches: patch inlets vs. input objects in the sub patch
channel.description: Hey friends, wondering what the best method is to control poly subpatch parameters via CC or NRPN. would i rather have the midi input in the subpatch, or have it in the main patch and route to the subpatch via an inlet? whats the benefits of each version?

item.title: Subpatches: patch inlets vs. input objects in the sub patch
item.dc:creator: @weasel79 blender
item.description:
@weasel79 wrote:

Yeah thanks those were exactly the thoughts i was having.. but i also vaguely remember reading that subpatch i/o as well as parameter remote control via the patcher object cc mapping is quite heavy on resources?

Read full topic
item.source: Subpatches: patch inlets vs. input objects in the sub patch

item.title: Subpatches: patch inlets vs. input objects in the sub patch
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

If you have the midi stuff in the polyphonic subpatch and you set it to 7 voices you use 7 of every midi objects that you use.

If you have them outside nd route inside via inlet, it uses less cpu/memory.

But to be honest not sure what would be the best functional wise but cpu/memory wise having it outside is the best solution.

Read full topic
item.source: Subpatches: patch inlets vs. input objects in the sub patch
